qas.question: What ranking does the Boston television DMA hold?
What is the sister station to WBZ-TV?
What is the citys PBS station?
MundoFox is an example of what?
Where are most of the television stations transmitters located?

context: The Boston television DMA, which also includes Manchester, New Hampshire, is the <a0_0>8th largest in the United States<a0_0/>. The city is served by stations representing every major American network, including WBZ-TV and its sister station <a1_0>WSBK-TV<a1_0/> (the former a CBS O&O, the latter an MyNetwork TV affiliate), WCVB-TV (ABC), WHDH (NBC), WFXT (Fox), and WLVI (The CW). The city is also home to PBS station <a2_0>WGBH-TV<a2_0/>, a major producer of PBS programs, which also operates WGBX. <a3_0>Spanish-language television networks<a3_0/>, including MundoFox (WFXZ-CD), Univision (WUNI), Telemundo (WNEU), and Telefutura (WUTF-DT), have a presence in the region, with WNEU and WUTF serving as network owned-and-operated stations. Most of the area's television stations have their transmitters in nearby <a4_0>Needham and Newton<a4_0/> along the Route 128 corridor. Six Boston television stations are carried by Canadian satellite television provider Bell TV and by cable television providers in Canada.
